descriptionModule.briefSummary: This is a pilot randomized controlled trial which will test the effect of 3 different anti-hypertensive agents and 3 different strategies of engaging young adults in home blood pressure monitoring on blood pressure control, with secondary outcomes focused on quality of life and adverse events.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: 3x3 by BP agent and BP monitoring approach

armGroups.label: Amlodipine 2.5 mg + Home BP monitoring with cuffed device
armGroups.description: Use of at least the minimum dose of amlodipine and use of a home BP monitoring device for BP monitoring
interventionNames: Device: Home BP monitoring with cuffed device

armGroups.label: Chlorthalidone 12.5 mg + Home BP monitoring with cuffed device
armGroups.description: Use of at least the minimum dose of chlorthalidone and use of a home BP monitoring device for BP monitoring
interventionNames: Device: Home BP monitoring with cuffed device

armGroups.label: Losartan 12.5 mg daily + home BP monitoring with cuffed device
armGroups.description: Use of at least the minimum dose of losartan and use of a home BP monitoring cuffed device only for BP monitoring
interventionNames: Device: Home BP monitoring with cuffed device

armGroups.label: amlodipine 2.5 mg daily + home BP monitoring with patch
armGroups.description: Use of at least the minimum dose of this agent and use of a home BP monitoring device only + a patch for BP monitoring
interventionNames: Device: Home BP monitoring with cuffed device + BP patch

armGroups.label: Chlorthalidone 12.5 mg daily + home BP monitoring with patch
armGroups.description: Use of at least the minimum dose of this agent and use of a home BP monitoring device only + a patch for BP monitoring
interventionNames: Device: Home BP monitoring with cuffed device + BP patch

armGroups.label: Losartan 12.5 mg daily + home BP monitoring with patch
armGroups.description: Use of at least the minimum dose of this agent and use of a home BP monitoring device only + a patch for BP monitoring
interventionNames: Device: Home BP monitoring with cuffed device + BP patch

armGroups.label: amlodipine 2.5 mg daily + home BP monitoring with watch
armGroups.description: Use of at least the minimum dose of this agent and use of a home BP monitoring device only + a watch for BP monitoring
interventionNames: Device: Home BP monitoring with cuffed device + BP watch

armGroups.label: chlorthalidone 12.5 mg daily + home BP monitoring with watch
armGroups.description: Use of at least the minimum dose of this agent and use of a home BP monitoring device only + a watch for BP monitoring
interventionNames: Device: Home BP monitoring with cuffed device + BP watch

armGroups.label: losartan 12.5 mg daily + home BP monitoring with watch
armGroups.description: Use of at least the minimum dose of this agent and use of a home BP monitoring device only + a watch for BP monitoring
interventionNames: Device: Home BP monitoring with cuffed device + BP watch

interventions.name: Anti-hypertensive agent: amlodipine
interventions.description: Patients with hypertension will be randomly assigned to be treated with amlodipine, chlorthalidone, or losartan. All drugs will be initiated at the lowest dose and uptitrated as needed to achieve standard BP targets.
armGroupLabels: Amlodipine 2.5 mg + Home BP monitoring with cuffed device
amlodipine 2.5 mg daily + home BP monitoring with patch
amlodipine 2.5 mg daily + home BP monitoring with watch

interventions.name: Anti-hypertensive agent: Chlorthalidone
interventions.description: Patients with hypertension will be randomly assigned to be treated with amlodipine, chlorthalidone, or losartan. All drugs will be initiated at the lowest dose and uptitrated as needed to achieve standard BP targets.
armGroupLabels: Chlorthalidone 12.5 mg + Home BP monitoring with cuffed device
Chlorthalidone 12.5 mg daily + home BP monitoring with patch
chlorthalidone 12.5 mg daily + home BP monitoring with watch

interventions.name: Anti-hypertensive agent: Losartan
interventions.description: Patients with hypertension will be randomly assigned to be treated with amlodipine, chlorthalidone, or losartan. All drugs will be initiated at the lowest dose and uptitrated as needed to achieve standard BP targets.
armGroupLabels: Losartan 12.5 mg daily + home BP monitoring with cuffed device
Losartan 12.5 mg daily + home BP monitoring with patch
losartan 12.5 mg daily + home BP monitoring with watch

interventions.name: Home BP monitoring with cuffed device
interventions.description: Patients will be randomized to monitor their blood pressure either with a BP cuffed device alone, versus with either or use of a BP monitoring patch or BP monitoring watch.
armGroupLabels: Amlodipine 2.5 mg + Home BP monitoring with cuffed device
Chlorthalidone 12.5 mg + Home BP monitoring with cuffed device
Losartan 12.5 mg daily + home BP monitoring with cuffed device

interventions.name: Home BP monitoring with cuffed device + BP patch
interventions.description: Patients will be randomized to monitor their blood pressure either with a BP cuffed device alone, versus with either or use of a BP monitoring patch or BP monitoring watch.
armGroupLabels: Chlorthalidone 12.5 mg daily + home BP monitoring with patch
Losartan 12.5 mg daily + home BP monitoring with patch
amlodipine 2.5 mg daily + home BP monitoring with patch

interventions.name: Home BP monitoring with cuffed device + BP watch
interventions.description: Patients will be randomized to monitor their blood pressure either with a BP cuffed device alone, versus with either or use of a BP monitoring patch or BP monitoring watch.
armGroupLabels: amlodipine 2.5 mg daily + home BP monitoring with watch
chlorthalidone 12.5 mg daily + home BP monitoring with watch
losartan 12.5 mg daily + home BP monitoring with watch

primaryOutcomes.description: Systolic blood pressure will be collected using at home cuffed devices. The readings at end of the pilot trial (or most recent readings available) will be used for analysis of the primary outcome.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Percent of weeks with at least 9 self-measured readings per week

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* 18-40 years of age
* Diagnosis of hypertension or receiving anti-hypertensive therapy OR Has clinical BP readings \>130/80 mmHg that would meet the definition of hypertension and have home BP readings \>=125/80 mmHg

Exclusion Criteria:

* are or are planning to become pregnant, due to inability to take multiple classes of anti- hypertensive agents
* are marginally housed, due to concerns regarding routine follow-up
* are actively participating in a different interventional trial that may affect blood pressure
* are unwilling to consent to participate
* institutionalized individuals or prisoners
* are actively abusing illicit drugs or alcohol
* have a history of poor or doubtful compliance (e.g., frequently missed appointments)
* have cognitive impairment prohibiting participation in the study
* History of allergy to any of the randomized medications
* Serum potassium \>5.5 meq/L at the screening visit
* BP \> 160/100 mmHg in clinic (stage II hypertension), regardless of whether patient is on therapy
* eGFR \< 30 mL/min/1.73 m2

references.citation: Johnson HM, Warner RC, Bartels CM, LaMantia JN. "They're younger... it's harder." Primary providers' perspectives on hypertension management in young adults: a multicenter qualitative study. BMC Res Notes. 2017 Jan 3;10(1):9. doi: 10.1186/s13104-016-2332-8.
